Test Steps.Step Action: Login application and navigate to Voter Management and click on Voter Ballot
Test Steps.Step Expected: Search Absentee Ballot page is dispalyed

Test Steps.Step Action: Search for Voter by Voter ID or Last name
Test Steps.Step Expected: Voter Search results are displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Select Voter and click on Actions and click the View Ballots
Test Steps.Step Expected: Absentee Ballot Voter Information page is displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on the Add button
Test Steps.Step Expected: Expanded view of Voter Ballot page is displayed along with the Voter Information

Test Steps.Step Action: In the Ballot Request Information verify the required fields and compare with V9 data for the dropdown values\nElection Date and Name, Ballot Type, Request Date and Application Received By
Test Steps.Step Expected: Election Date and Name are required fields\nBallot Type are required field\nRequest Date and Application Received By are required fields

Test Steps.Step Action: When select Multiple Ballot Requested checkbox verify the Multiple Request Reason dropdown values and when select OTHER from the dropdown the Other Text field column is highlighted
Test Steps.Step Expected: All the Multiple Ballot Requested reasons are displayed and the Other text field is highlighted when OTHER is selected

Test Steps.Step Action: When select Application Denied checkbox verify the Multiple Request Reason dropdown values and when select OTHER from the dropdown the Other Text field column is highlighted\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: All the Application Denied reasons are displayed and the Other text field is highlighted when OTHER is selected\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Verify the required fields for Regular Absentee Voter Reason dropdown values matches the reasons displayed in V9\nApplication type =FPCA and Notes
Test Steps.Step Expected:
Regular Absentee Reason dropdown values match v9
Application type = FPCA 
checkbox for Lives Within City Limits
Notes text field displayed

Test Steps.Step Action:
In the Ballot Issued Information section verify the 
Issue Date format
Ballot Delivered By
Notes
Checkbox for Emergency Ballot
Ability to default to Domestic Address and has international address information
Test Steps.Step Expected: All the below fields are available and the works as expected

Test Steps.Step Action: Verify the following actions are successfully performed for UOCOVA voters \nUOCAVA: If UOCAVA forwarding address is available in the voter registration and the start and end date is between the election date-see expected resultMailing: If UOCAVA forwarding address is not present or is out of the start or end date in the voter registration information-see expected result.Residential: If UOCAVA and Mailing address are not present in the voter registration information then-see expected result
Test Steps.Step Expected: UOCAVA: If UOCAVA forwarding address is available and the current date is between the start and end date of UOCAVA, then the UOCAVA forwarding address will auto populate. Mailing: If UOCAVA forwarding address is not present or is out of the start or end date then the Voter Mailing address will be used.Residential: If UOCAVA and Mailing address are not present then the Voter Residential address will be used.

Test Steps.Step Action:
In the Ballot Returned Information verify the following
1. Date Ballot Received
2. Ballot Received By
3. Person Delivering Ballot
4.Ballot Return Status dropdown is available
5. Ballot Return Status Reason is enabled when a Ballot Return status is selected
6. Checkbox for Ballot Provisional or Challenged is available and when check that box      the Ballot Provisional or Challenged Reason is enabled and required
7. Note section is available
8. Voter Assisted checkbox is available and when selected the Person Assisting with Ballot first and last Name with Phone number gets enabled
Test Steps.Step Expected: All the fields work as expected with reasons taken from v9 are available for Ballot Return Status and Ballot Return Status Reason

Title: Verify Absentee ballot details appear in the new tab

Test Steps.Step Action: Home > Search for voter > Actions > View Voter Information page> Absentee Ballot History tab.
Test Steps.Step Expected: Absentee ballot details are displayed in the Voter Details tab.\n

Title: VM - Ballot - Add/Maintain (Absentee) Ballot display signature

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to the 'Add Ballot' screen for a voter (that has no uploaded signature)\nVM > Voter > Search for Active Voter (Without Signature)> Click actions and select 'Add Absentee Ballot'
Test Steps.Step Expected: 'NO SIGNATURE ON FILE' button is displayed grayed out.

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to the 'Add Ballot' screen for a voter (that has uploaded a signature)\nVM > Voter > Search for Active Voter (With Signature)> Click actions and select 'Add Absentee Ballot'\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: 'VIEW SIGNATURE' button appears

Test Steps.Step Action: Click the 'VIEW SIGNATURE'
Test Steps.Step Expected: Popup/Modal appears and displays the voters signature

Test Steps.Step Expected: Must be placed above the Mailing address fields

Title: VM - Ballot - Maintain Outstanding Absentee Ballots

Test Steps.Step Action: VM - Ballot - Absentee Batch Processes
Navigate to the "Voter" section and search for a voter
Test Steps.Step Expected: The user is able to search and select the voter successfully.

Test Steps.Step Action: On the voter information page, verify the "Absentee" tab is visible and accessible
Test Steps.Step Expected: The "Absentee Ballot" tab is displayed and accessible.

Test Steps.Step Action: Verify the "Add/Maintain UOCAVA/Permanent Absentee Status" button is visible under the "Absentee" tab
Test Steps.Step Expected: The button is clearly labeled as "Add/Maintain UOCAVA/Permanent Absentee Status" under the "Absentee Ballot" tab.

Test Steps.Step Action: Click the "Add/Maintain UOCAVA/Permanent Absentee Status" button
Test Steps.Step Expected: The user is navigated to a dedicated page for managing absentee status.

Test Steps.Step Action: Verify the stand-alone page is displayed with the voter card at the top
Test Steps.Step Expected: The page displays the voter card at the top.

Test Steps.Step Action: Verify the input fields on the page: - Annual Absentee Status (Dropdown) - Annual Absentee Status Reason (Dropdown) - UOCAVA Start Date (Date Picker) - UOCAVA End Date (Date Picker) - Ballot Mailing Address Checkbox (Conditional) - Mail Forwarding Address (Enabled for UOCAVA/FPCA)
Test Steps.Step Expected: All input fields are displayed correctly and are functional based on selection logic.

Test Steps.Step Action: Select "UOCAVA/FPCA" and verify the options in "Annual Absentee Status Reason" dropdown
Test Steps.Step Expected: The dropdown shows only: "Citizen Residing Overseas," "Member of Uniformed Services," "Spouse/Dependent of Uniformed Services Member."

Test Steps.Step Action: Select "Annual Application" and verify the options in "Annual Absentee Status Reason" dropdown
Test Steps.Step Expected: The dropdown shows only: "65 Years of Age or Older," "Disability," "Expected to Give Birth."

Test Steps.Step Action: Select "Annual Application" and check the Ballot Mailing Address checkbox
Test Steps.Step Expected: The system autofills the ballot mailing address with the voter’s registered address and locks the fields for editing.

Test Steps.Step Action: Uncheck the Ballot Mailing Address checkbox and verify the mailing address fields are editable
Test Steps.Step Expected: The mailing address fields become editable after unchecking the checkbox.

Test Steps.Step Action: Select "UOCAVA/FPCA" and verify the Mail Forwarding Address fields are enabled
Test Steps.Step Expected: The Mail Forwarding Address fields are enabled for input when "UOCAVA/FPCA" is selected.

Test Steps.Step Action: Select UOCAVA/FPCA and verify that the "Preferred Method" dropdown displays "Mail," "Email," and "Fax"
Test Steps.Step Expected: The "Preferred Method" dropdown shows the options: Mail, Email, and Fax.

Test Steps.Step Action: Select "Annual Application" and verify that only "Mail" is available in the "Preferred Method" dropdown
Test Steps.Step Expected: The "Preferred Method" dropdown shows only "Mail."

Test Steps.Step Action: Verify error handling for missing required fields (e.g., missing status reason or start/end date)
Test Steps.Step Expected: \nAn error message is displayed indicating the missing required fields.\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Verify error handling if "Annual/UOCAVA End Date" is earlier than "Annual/UOCAVA Start Date"
Test Steps.Step Expected: An error message prompts the user to correct the dates.

Test Steps.Step Action: Input valid data into all required fields and click the "Save" button
Test Steps.Step Expected: The system saves the data and updates the voter’s absentee status. The user is navigated back to the voter history page.

Test Steps.Step Action: Modify the absentee status and click "Save" to update
Test Steps.Step Expected: The system reflects the updated absentee status immediately after saving.

Test Steps.Step Action: Verify that the system tracks and records changes for audit purposes
Test Steps.Step Expected: The audit logs track the changes made to the absentee status with details like the date and the user who made the changes.

Test Steps.Step Action: Simulate an error during the save/update process
Test Steps.Step Expected: The system displays a relevant error message, and no data is saved until the issue is resolved.

Test Steps.Step Action: Verify that the "Add/Maintain UOCAVA/Permanent Absentee Status" button changes to "Add/Maintain UOCAVA/Annual Absentee" after saving/updating
Test Steps.Step Expected: The button is updated to "Add/Maintain UOCAVA/Annual Absentee" after saving or updating the status.
